intro: Catimbaua pendula, commonly known as the hanging catimbaua, is a species of flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its pendulous, showy flowers that bloom in clusters, often in shades of red and pink. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Catimbaua pendula thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in coastal regions.
